venue.address_1: 33 Stanhope St. in the alley behind Club Cafe
venue.name: The Brahmin

item.description:
Celebrate the winter solstice with secular style, in what has become a Boston Atheists tradition -- our annual winter solstice cocktail mixer. This year, we will be gathering at The Brahmin in Boston's Back Bay, for cocktails, passed appetizers, a full menu available in the kitchen, and good company. For those of you with a gustatory imagination, we can confirm that the passed apps will include vegetable crudites; fresh cherry tomato; bacon-wrapped scallops; Italian meatballs; and three kinds of flatbread. Full bar service will of course be available.

The cost to attend this event will be $25.00 collected at the door or via PayPal in advance to one of the event organizers, Julie Arnold or Zachary Bos. This price includes both a sparkling cider toast and a pouring of champagne, and a donation to Rosie's Place, a local women's shelter. Due to the nature of the event, please keep your RSVP updated so that we can get an accurate number of expected attendees.

Please join us for an evening of friends, food, and celebration, and do feel free to bring whatever guests you wish. Ours is an inclusive community -- friends and family, of whatever epistemological persuasion, are welcome to join us.
item.name: 2011 Winter Solstice Party
